docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the Teamsters union are rallying this morning outside the headquarters of FreshDirect, the local online grocery delivery service, to protest what they say is the company's effort to prevent more than 900 warehouse workers from unionizing.The company has denied doing anything improper, but is actively campaigning against the unionization drive, telling workers that union representation would not benefit them. Interestingly, one of FreshDirect's arguments is that the company -- which in July celebrated the fifth anniversary of its first delivery -- has yet to turn a profit.
docs.abstract: Members of the Teamsters are rallying outside FreshDirect's headquarters in Long Island City, Queens, accusing the online grocer of firing two workers because of their union sympathies.
docs.snippet: Members of the Teamsters are rallying outside FreshDirect's headquarters in Long Island City, Queens, accusing the online grocer of firing two workers because of their union sympathies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Congressional leaders today pleaded for President Bush to change his mind on the health insurance bill.

headline.main: Bush Stands by Veto Threat on Children’s Health Bill

docs.snippet: Democratic Congressional leaders today pleaded for President Bush to change his mind on the health insurance bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate gave final approval on Thursday to a health insurance bill for 10 million children, clearing the measure for President Bush, who said he would veto it.
docs.snippet: The Senate gave final approval on Thursday to a health insurance bill for 10 million children, clearing the measure for President Bush, who said he would veto it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our political discourse is so debased that the “s-word” is typically applied where it is least appropriate and never applied where it most fits.

docs.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J., Sept. 26 — Gov. Jon S. Corzine, making his first public appearance since having surgery nine days ago on the leg he broke in a near-fatal car crash, appeared eager Wednesday to let New Jerseyans know that his recovery was not distracting him from the task of running their state.

headline.main: With His Leg on the Mend, New Jersey’s Governor Is Back to Business
headline.print_headline: With His Leg on the Mend, New Jersey’s Governor Is Back to Business

docs.lead_paragraph: The House approved a stopgap spending bill to finance the operations of the federal government, including the Children’s Health Insurance Program, through mid-November.

headline.main: House Passes a Stopgap Bill to Pay for Programs
headline.print_headline: House Passes a Stopgap Bill to Pay for Programs
